title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message:
I've got a couple of these 820-2915 that have the same issue, missing LCD_PWR_EN at U9000. 
what I've checked

R9094 10k pin1 0v
R9678 4.7k pin 1 .012v pin 2 2.6v
no short to ground.

looks like I'm just not getting voltage for LCD_PWR_EN coming form U9600. Any ideas?

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: Yes it does boot and runs on external.

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: LCD is not recognized. LCD and cable known good? C9010 have 3V? Backlight not coming on also?

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: c9010 3v is present, tested with known good screen and cable no backlight  either. could maybe be the connector?

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message:
Check pin 6 and 7 on diode mode, once with screen once without.
SMC_LID high?

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message:
both pins at 1.051 in diode mode with screen plugged in and 1.053 without screen. SMC_LID 3.4V
SORRY  pin6-7 diode mode .450-.473

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: 1051 makes no sense. Those lines should measure a lot lower, 0.5 or 0.6 range.

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: sorry pin 6 was .450 pin 7 .473 didn't change when i unplugged the screen

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: Measure if pins 4 6 7 have continuity to the other side of an LCD cable.

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: no continuity on pin 4. 6 7 have continuity threw the cable. looks like its the connector?

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: The cable does flip left to right on the connectors, so beep out all pins on the other side.

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: ya i noticed that but still no continuity

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: Well, bad connector then, I bet someone tried to shove a 2012 cable in there.

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: lol probably. ill change it out and report back.

title: 820-2915 missing lcd power enable
message: problem solved. thanks for running me threw the diag process. Now for the other ones.
